content.title: Recurrent Normalization Propagation
content.abstract:
We propose an LSTM parametrization  that preserves the means and variances of the hidden states and memory cells across time. While having training benefits similar to Recurrent Batch Normalization and Layer Normalization, it does not need to estimate statistics at each time step,  therefore, requiring fewer computations overall. We also investigate the parametrization impact on the gradient flows and  present a way of initializing the weights accordingly.

We evaluate our proposal on language modelling and image generative modelling tasks. We empirically show that it performs similarly or better than other recurrent normalization approaches, while being faster to execute.
content.TL;DR: Extension of Normalization Propagation to the LSTM.
